intro: Ballota aucheri, commonly known as the Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Ballota aucheri is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
